text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with boyo and crema this is a
simple boiled chicken slowly simmered in
sour cream and chicken stock it's a dish
I used to have the place called Aunt
Mary's in the mission in San Francisco
some of you may remember it this is my
version of that very very comforting
dish I got one big old chicken throw in
a pot I got some chicken stock some
water and this is a crema this is just
Mexican sour cream you can use American
sour cream or French creme fresh bell
works I'm going to put in some hot
pepper jalapeno some onion some tomato
not vine-ripened just basic supermarket
roma tomatoes they don't have to be good
in fact it's better if they're not good
all right we're going to throw in some
pepper some sweet pepper a couple cloves
of garlic some oregano a bay leaf and
some cayenne pepper and of course some
pepper and salt now the beauty of this
dish is its incredible incredible
simplicity we're going to push all those
veggies down into the stock and the sour
cream don't worry about the sour cream
breaking or separating or curling it's
all going to smooth out at the end we're
going to cover that and on low heat
we're going to simmer that for one hour
then I'm going to turn it over and
simmer it for another half hour
now before I cover this back up I want
to show you something here there's two
little muscles on the bottom of a
chicken right there called the oysters
because they're shaped like an oyster
there's one on either side of the
backbone and it is the most flavorful
meat on the chicken so there's a little
trivia for you and by the way when
you're cutting the chicken and its raw
state that's what you want to visualize
be careful you want to get that little
piece of muscle as you cut underneath
the the chicken there Gerber be building
the chicken alright another 1/2 hours
passed I'm going to take off the lid
there I'm going to take the chicken out
so it's basically simmered very slowly
for an hour and a half
all right and that it was a big chicken
it was like 4 pound chicken big old
chicken ok so I'm going to let that cool
enough where I can cut it into serving
pieces and I'm going to turn to stock up
to
hi and you'll see see how the sour cream
is not curdled anymore it's kind of
melted back into the stock all right
we're gonna take a ladle because it's
boiling you're going to get that fat
pulling up in different spots easy to
skim off the chicken we're going to cut
into just big serving size pieces and
put that back in I normally take the
skin off when I serve it so anyway put
the chicken back in when the carcass
cools you can pull off all the smaller
pieces of meat throw them into don't
waste anything
or I'm gonna throw in a big handful of
chopped cilantro and because I filmed
this in the evening the light stinks
especially when you got you know a pot
of steaming stew and the light is bad it
looks terrible there so I waited until I
had some natural light the next day to
serve this and look how beautiful that
is I served it with some Spanish rice
which I will be demoing soon actually
just film that for about calm and that's
it polio and crema a simple boiled
chicken it doesn't get any easier than
this this is just really great Mexican
comfort food or Salvadorian I think the
restaurant was actually Salvadorian not
Mexican but anyway simple comfort food
at its best give that a try go to the
site all the ingredients are there
there's not that many but you can get
them there and as always enjoy
[Music]
